subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue(true)
msgSnippet: ... I would go further and say that asserting against the actual message provides a good unit test for when you refactor to an internationalized design. Kevin
messageBody:
Jason Rogers wrote:
> Cedric Beust wrote:
>>> assertStringContains(e.getMessage(), <exceptionReason
>>>dealing with badParameter>);
>>
>>I don't think it's a good idea to assert against exception messages since
>>your tests will be hard to port when you internationalize your
>>application.
>
> Nope... do what's neccessary. Why deal with internationalization when
> there is no track for it whatsoever?
>

I would go further and say that asserting against the actual message
provides a good unit test for when you refactor to an internationalized
design.

Kevin
